args_definition.name: value
args_definition.title: Value
args_definition.tooltip:
Current value of the input field, i.e. what is written in the field.

This is an **Input property**, meaning that any bindings are two-way. For example, if you bind a page variable to this property, changes to the page variable will change the text in the input. Similarly, if the user changes the input text, the bound page variable will follow that value.
args_definition.description:
Current value of the input field, i.e. what is written in the field.

This is an **Input property**, meaning that any bindings are two-way. For example, if you bind a page variable to this property, changes to the page variable will change the text in the input. Similarly, if the user changes the input text, the bound page variable will follow that value.

args_definition.title: Placeholder text
args_definition.tooltip: Placeholder text to show when the input **Value** is empty.
args_definition.description: Placeholder text to show when the input **Value** is empty.

args_definition.name: keyboardType
args_definition.title: Keyboard type
args_definition.tooltip:
Keyboard type to use on mobile devices. Defaults to the basic text keyboard.

To input number values, you should use the **Number input** component instead.
args_definition.description:
Keyboard type to use on mobile devices. Defaults to the basic text keyboard.

To input number values, you should use the **Number input** component instead.

args_definition.name: disabled
args_definition.title: Disabled
args_definition.tooltip: True/false value to disable the input field. When an input is disabled, it cannot be focused by user interaction, and text can't be inputted into it.
args_definition.description: True/false value to disable the input field. When an input is disabled, it cannot be focused by user interaction, and text can't be inputted into it.

args_definition.name: multiline
args_definition.title: Multiline input
args_definition.tooltip: Allow the input to go on multiple lines.
args_definition.description: Allow the input to go on multiple lines.

args_definition.name: autoCapitalize
args_definition.title: Auto-capitalize
args_definition.tooltip:
Make the input field automatically capitalize certain characters:

- `none`: no forced capitalization
- `sentences`: sentences are forced to start with a capital letter
- `words`: words are forced to start with a capital letter
- `characters`: every character is forced into a capital letter
args_definition.description:
Make the input field automatically capitalize certain characters:

- `none`: no forced capitalization
- `sentences`: sentences are forced to start with a capital letter
- `words`: words are forced to start with a capital letter
- `characters`: every character is forced into a capital letter

args_definition.name: secureTextEntry
args_definition.title: Password input
args_definition.tooltip: True/false value to mask the inputted text by replacing each character with a dot (•), commonly used for password input fields.
args_definition.description: True/false value to mask the inputted text by replacing each character with a dot (•), commonly used for password input fields.

subflows.info:
Make a HTTP request to the given URL.

In most cases, you should use **Data** in the top toolbar to configure a new REST resource instead, as that allows you to define explicit schemas for the request/response, required headers, allowed query parameters and more.

You can choose the method and customize headers for the request. For methods than GET, you can also include a request body.

If the request is successful (i.e. the response status code is within 200 range), the first output is triggered. The second output is triggered if the response status code is within the range of 400 - 500.

The third output is triggered if error occures while trying to make a HTTP request to the give URL.

The flow function returns the response body in raw text format, and as parsed JSON if possible.

By default, the `Content-Type: application/json` and `Accept: application/json` headers are included in the request.

If you change the **Request body type** to `x-www-form-urlencoded`, the `Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded` header is included instead.

To upload and download binary files, consider using the **Download file**, **Upload file** and **Upload multiple files** flow functions instead.
subflows.name: HTTP request

arguments.title: URL
arguments.description: Target URL for the request.

arguments.title: HTTP method
arguments.description: HTTP method to use

arguments.name: headers
arguments.title: Headers
arguments.description: Headers to include in the HTTP call.

arguments.name: body
arguments.title: Request body
arguments.description: JSON body to send with the request. If HTTP method is GET, this argument is ignored.

arguments.name: bodyType
arguments.title: Request body type
arguments.description: Request body type. If `x-www-form-urlencoded` is chosen, **Request body** is expected to be a flat object that is converted to the required key-value pairs.

subflows.info: Display a blocking alert dialog with a button to dimiss it. Flow execution will continue after the button is pressed.
subflows.name: Alert

arguments.name: title
arguments.title: Dialog title
arguments.description: Title text to show on the alert dialog.

arguments.name: message
arguments.title: Dialog message
arguments.description: Message text to show under the title.

arguments.name: dismissLabel
arguments.title: Dismiss button label
arguments.description: Text label on the dismiss button.

subflows.info: Makes the target view component visible by setting its **Visible** property to `true`.
subflows.name: Show component

arguments.name: componentId
arguments.title: View component
arguments.description: Target view component to make visible.

subflows.info:
Returns the user to the initial view. All open app pages are stopped and removed from memory.

To use this flow, you must have enabled authentication and configured an initial view for your app via the **Users** section of the global toolbar.

Will only work if the initial view is not already open.
subflows.name: Return to initial view

subflows.info:
Invalidates the current user session in the backend when using AppGyver Hosted/Cloud Auth.

If the invalidation is successful, the first output is triggered.

If an error occurs, the second output is triggered.

To remove the local session, you should use the **Remove local session (AppGyver Auth)** flow after this one.
subflows.name: Invalidate backend session (AppGyver Auth)

error.name: error
error.title: Error
error.description:
One of the following error codes:

- `unknown`: Thrown if an unknown error occured while invalidating the backend session.

subflows.info:
Sets currently repeated item property to a new value, updating the variable used as the repeat source.

Must be used on the logic canvas of a repeated view component. Only works if the repeat source is a direct binding to a page/app/data variable and not a formula.

If the selected property is an object, only the selected fields will be affected.
subflows.name: Set repeated item value

args.description: Text content for the label.

args.name: optionList
args.title: Option list
args.tooltip: The list of options available to the dropdown component, given as an array of objects with `label` and `value`.
args.description: The list of options available to the dropdown component, given as an array of objects with `label` and `value`.

args.name: value
args.title: Selected value
args.tooltip:
Value of the currently selected option.

This is an **Input property**, meaning that any variable bindings are two-way. Changing the bound variable elsewhere affects the selected value, and selecting another value via the dropdown propagates the change to the bound variable.
args.description:
Value of the currently selected option.

This is an **Input property**, meaning that any variable bindings are two-way. Changing the bound variable elsewhere affects the selected value, and selecting another value via the dropdown propagates the change to the bound variable.

args.name: placeholder
args.title: Placeholder text
args.tooltip: Placeholder text to show when there's no value selected, i.e. **Selected value** is `null` or `undefined` or does not match any of the values in the **Option list** array.
args.description: Placeholder text to show when there's no value selected, i.e. **Selected value** is `null` or `undefined` or does not match any of the values in the **Option list** array.

args.name: visible
args.title: Visible
args.tooltip: True/false value to set component visibility. If `false`, the component is not rendered at all and will not take up any space.
args.description: True/false value to set component visibility. If `false`, the component is not rendered at all and will not take up any space.

args.name: label
args.title: Selected label
args.tooltip:
Label of the currently selected option.

This value is determined by the **Selected value** property. Changing this property will not affect the **Selected value** property, and any changes will get overridden when a new **Selected value** is selected. In essence, this property should be treated as a read-only.
args.description:
Label of the currently selected option.

This value is determined by the **Selected value** property. Changing this property will not affect the **Selected value** property, and any changes will get overridden when a new **Selected value** is selected. In essence, this property should be treated as a read-only.

args.name: showSelectedValueAsLabel
args.title: Show value as label
args.tooltip:
If `true`, show selected value as the label in the dropdown. The dropdown options themselves will still be labels.

Useful if you e.g. want to show a dropdown of phone country codes with country name in the dropdown, but just show the selected country code when the dropdown is closed.
args.description:
If `true`, show selected value as the label in the dropdown. The dropdown options themselves will still be labels.

Useful if you e.g. want to show a dropdown of phone country codes with country name in the dropdown, but just show the selected country code when the dropdown is closed.

components.composite_preview: Title label

args.name: label
args.title: Label
args.tooltip: Label text content.
args.description: Label text content.

args.name: value
args.title: Value
args.tooltip:
Current value of the slider, represented by the slider's horizontal position.

This is an **Input property**, meaning that any bindings are two-way. For example, if you bind a page variable to this property, changes to the page variable will change the slider position. Similarly, if the user changes the slider position, the bound page variable will follow that value.
args.description:
Current value of the slider, represented by the slider's horizontal position.

This is an **Input property**, meaning that any bindings are two-way. For example, if you bind a page variable to this property, changes to the page variable will change the slider position. Similarly, if the user changes the slider position, the bound page variable will follow that value.

args.name: minValue
args.title: Minimum value
args.tooltip:
Minimum value for the slider's range of allowed values. This value is inclusive and represents the slider at its far left position.

For example, minimum value `1` would mean the slider's **Value** property is `1` when it's at the far left.
args.description:
Minimum value for the slider's range of allowed values. This value is inclusive and represents the slider at its far left position.

For example, minimum value `1` would mean the slider's **Value** property is `1` when it's at the far left.

args.name: maxValue
args.title: Maximum value
args.tooltip:
Maximum value for the slider's range of allowed values. This value is inclusive and represents the slider at its far right position.

For example, maximum value `10` would mean the slider's **Value** property is `10` when it's at the far left.
args.description:
Maximum value for the slider's range of allowed values. This value is inclusive and represents the slider at its far right position.

For example, maximum value `10` would mean the slider's **Value** property is `10` when it's at the far left.

args.name: step
args.title: Step
args.tooltip: Minimum slider step. For example, if this value is `0.5`, possible values would include 1, 1.5, 2, 2.5, 3 and so on.
args.description: Minimum slider step. For example, if this value is `0.5`, possible values would include 1, 1.5, 2, 2.5, 3 and so on.

args.name: disabled
args.title: Disabled
args.tooltip: True/false value to set if the slider is disabled. Input components in disabled state cannot be manipulated by the user.
args.description: True/false value to set if the slider is disabled. Input components in disabled state cannot be manipulated by the user.

args.name: visible
args.title: Visible
args.tooltip: True/false value to set component visibility. If `false`, the component is not rendered at all and will not take up any space.
args.description: True/false value to set component visibility. If `false`, the component is not rendered at all and will not take up any space.

components.composite_preview: Label

args.name: label
args.title: Label
args.tooltip: Label text content.
args.description: Label text content.

args.name: value
args.title: Value
args.tooltip:
Current value of the input field, i.e. what is written in the field.

This is an **Input property**, meaning that any bindings are two-way. For example, if you bind a page variable to this property, changes to the page variable will change the text in the input. Similarly, if the user changes the input text, the bound page variable will follow that value.
args.description:
Current value of the input field, i.e. what is written in the field.

This is an **Input property**, meaning that any bindings are two-way. For example, if you bind a page variable to this property, changes to the page variable will change the text in the input. Similarly, if the user changes the input text, the bound page variable will follow that value.

args.name: passwordInput
args.title: Password input
args.tooltip: True/false value to mask the inputted text by replacing each character with a dot (•), commonly used for password input fields.
args.description: True/false value to mask the inputted text by replacing each character with a dot (•), commonly used for password input fields.

args.name: placeholder
args.title: Placeholder text
args.tooltip: Placeholder text to show when the input **Value** is empty.
args.description: Placeholder text to show when the input **Value** is empty.

args.name: autoCapitalize
args.title: Auto-capitalize
args.tooltip:
Make the input field automatically capitalize certain characters:

- `none`: no forced capitalization
- `sentences`: sentences are forced to start with a capital letter
- `words`: words are forced to start with a capital letter
- `characters`: every character is forced into a capital letter
args.description:
Make the input field automatically capitalize certain characters:

- `none`: no forced capitalization
- `sentences`: sentences are forced to start with a capital letter
- `words`: words are forced to start with a capital letter
- `characters`: every character is forced into a capital letter

args.name: disabled
args.title: Disabled
args.tooltip: True/false value to set the input field in disabled state, meaning the user cannot interact with it.
args.description: True/false value to set the input field in disabled state, meaning the user cannot interact with it.

args.name: keyboardType
args.title: Keyboard type
args.tooltip:
Keyboard type to use on mobile devices. Defaults to the basic text keyboard.

To input number values, you should use the **Number input** component instead.
args.description:
Keyboard type to use on mobile devices. Defaults to the basic text keyboard.

To input number values, you should use the **Number input** component instead.

args.name: multlineInput
args.title: Multiline input
args.tooltip: Allow the text input to go on multiple lines.
args.description: Allow the text input to go on multiple lines.

args.name: visible
args.title: Visible
args.tooltip: True/false value to set component visibility. If `false`, the component is not rendered at all and will not take up any space.
args.description: True/false value to set component visibility. If `false`, the component is not rendered at all and will not take up any space.

components.composite_preview: Password label

args.name: label
args.title: Label
args.tooltip: Label text content.
args.description: Label text content.

args.name: value
args.title: Value
args.tooltip:
Current value of the input field, i.e. what is written in the field.

This is an **Input property**, meaning that any bindings are two-way. For example, if you bind a page variable to this property, changes to the page variable will change the text in the input. Similarly, if the user changes the input text, the bound page variable will follow that value.
args.description:
Current value of the input field, i.e. what is written in the field.

This is an **Input property**, meaning that any bindings are two-way. For example, if you bind a page variable to this property, changes to the page variable will change the text in the input. Similarly, if the user changes the input text, the bound page variable will follow that value.

args.name: placeholder
args.title: Placeholder text
args.tooltip: Placeholder text to show when the input **Value** is empty.
args.description: Placeholder text to show when the input **Value** is empty.

args.name: autoCapitalize
args.title: Auto-capitalize
args.tooltip:
Make the input field automatically capitalize certain characters:

- `none`: no forced capitalization
- `sentences`: sentences are forced to start with a capital letter
- `words`: words are forced to start with a capital letter
- `characters`: every character is forced into a capital letter
args.description:
Make the input field automatically capitalize certain characters:

- `none`: no forced capitalization
- `sentences`: sentences are forced to start with a capital letter
- `words`: words are forced to start with a capital letter
- `characters`: every character is forced into a capital letter

args.name: disabled
args.title: Disabled
args.tooltip: True/false value to set the input field in disabled state, meaning the user cannot interact with it.
args.description: True/false value to set the input field in disabled state, meaning the user cannot interact with it.

args.name: keyboardType
args.title: Keyboard type
args.tooltip: Keyboard type to use on mobile devices. Defaults to the basic text keyboard.
args.description: Keyboard type to use on mobile devices. Defaults to the basic text keyboard.

args.name: multlineInput
args.title: Multiline input
args.tooltip: Allow the text input to go on multiple lines.
args.description: Allow the text input to go on multiple lines.

args.name: passwordInput
args.title: Password input
args.tooltip: True/false value to mask the inputted text by replacing each character with a dot (•), commonly used for password input fields.
args.description: True/false value to mask the inputted text by replacing each character with a dot (•), commonly used for password input fields.

args.name: visible
args.title: Visible
args.tooltip: True/false value to set component visibility. If `false`, the component is not rendered at all and will not take up any space.
args.description: True/false value to set component visibility. If `false`, the component is not rendered at all and will not take up any space.

components.composite_preview:
Label
Secondary

args.name: value
args.title: Value
args.tooltip:
Current value of the search input, i.e. what is written in the field.

This is an **Input property**, meaning that any bindings are two-way. For example, if you bind a page variable to this property, changes to the page variable will change the text in the input. Similarly, if the user changes the input text, the bound page variable will follow that value.
args.description:
Current value of the search input, i.e. what is written in the field.

This is an **Input property**, meaning that any bindings are two-way. For example, if you bind a page variable to this property, changes to the page variable will change the text in the input. Similarly, if the user changes the input text, the bound page variable will follow that value.

args.name: placeholder
args.title: Placeholder text
args.tooltip: Placeholder text to show when the search field **Value** is empty.
args.description: Placeholder text to show when the search field **Value** is empty.

args.name: disabled
args.title: Disabled
args.tooltip: True/false value to disable the search input field. When an input is disabled, it cannot be focused by user interaction, and text can't be inputted into it.
args.description: True/false value to disable the search input field. When an input is disabled, it cannot be focused by user interaction, and text can't be inputted into it.

args.name: searchIcon
args.title: Search icon name
args.tooltip: Name of the search icon.
args.description: Name of the search icon.

args.name: visible
args.title: Visible
args.tooltip: True/false value to set component visibility. If `false`, the component is not rendered at all and will not take up any space.
args.description: True/false value to set component visibility. If `false`, the component is not rendered at all and will not take up any space.

args.name: backgroundImage
args.title: Background Image
args.tooltip: Background image for the container. You can configure additional display options on the Style tab.
args.description: Background image for the container. You can configure additional display options on the Style tab.

args.tooltip: True/false value to set if the toggle switch is disabled. If `true`, the user cannot change the toggle switch value.
args.description: True/false value to set if the toggle switch is disabled. If `true`, the user cannot change the toggle switch value.

components.name: custom-26ea632b-6a4a-4da0-8806-c8c58b6d4a58

args.name: value
args.title: Value
args.tooltip:
Current value of the slider, represented by the slider's horizontal position

This is an **Input property**, meaning that any bindings are two-way. For example, if you bind a page variable to this property, changes to the page variable will change the slider position. Similarly, if the user changes the slider position, the bound page variable will follow that value.
args.description:
Current value of the slider, represented by the slider's horizontal position

This is an **Input property**, meaning that any bindings are two-way. For example, if you bind a page variable to this property, changes to the page variable will change the slider position. Similarly, if the user changes the slider position, the bound page variable will follow that value.

args.name: step
args.title: Step
args.tooltip: Minimum slider step. For example, if this value is `0.5`, possible values would include 1, 1.5, 2, 2.5, 3 and so on.
args.description: Minimum slider step. For example, if this value is `0.5`, possible values would include 1, 1.5, 2, 2.5, 3 and so on.

args.name: minimumValue
args.title: Minimum value
args.tooltip:
Minimum value for the slider's range of allowed values. This value is inclusive and represents the slider at its far left position.

For example, minimum value `1` would mean the slider's **Value** property is `1` when it's at the far left.
args.description:
Minimum value for the slider's range of allowed values. This value is inclusive and represents the slider at its far left position.

For example, minimum value `1` would mean the slider's **Value** property is `1` when it's at the far left.

args.name: maximumValue
args.title: Maximum value
args.tooltip:
Maximum value for the slider's range of allowed values. This value is inclusive and represents the slider at its far right position.

For example, maximum value `10` would mean the slider's **Value** property is `10` when it's at the far left.
args.description:
Maximum value for the slider's range of allowed values. This value is inclusive and represents the slider at its far right position.

For example, maximum value `10` would mean the slider's **Value** property is `10` when it's at the far left.

args.name: disabled
args.title: Disabled
args.tooltip: Boolean to set if the slider is disabled. Input components in disabled state cannot be manipulated by the user.
args.description: Boolean to set if the slider is disabled. Input components in disabled state cannot be manipulated by the user.

args.name: visible
args.title: Visible.
args.tooltip: True/false value to set component visibility. If `false`, the component is not rendered at all and will not take up any space.
args.description: True/false value to set component visibility. If `false`, the component is not rendered at all and will not take up any space.

args.description: True/false value, is checkbox checked or not?

components.name: custom-e6659a2e-ad70-44ba-9665-5e17181f88ea

args.name: value
args.title: Value
args.tooltip:
Current value of the input field, i.e. what is written in the field.

This is an **Input property**, meaning that any bindings are two-way. For example, if you bind a page variable to this property, changes to the page variable will change the text in the input. Similarly, if the user changes the input text, the bound page variable will follow that value.
args.description:
Current value of the input field, i.e. what is written in the field.

This is an **Input property**, meaning that any bindings are two-way. For example, if you bind a page variable to this property, changes to the page variable will change the text in the input. Similarly, if the user changes the input text, the bound page variable will follow that value.

args.name: placeholder
args.title: Placeholder text
args.tooltip: Placeholder text to show when the input **Value** is empty.
args.description: Placeholder text to show when the input **Value** is empty.

args.name: visible
args.title: Visible
args.tooltip: True/false value to set component visibility. If `false`, the component is not rendered at all and will not take up any space.
args.description: True/false value to set component visibility. If `false`, the component is not rendered at all and will not take up any space.

args.name: keyboardType
args.title: Keyboard type
args.tooltip:
Keyboard type to use on mobile devices. Defaults to the basic text keyboard.

To input number values, you should use the **Number input** component instead.
args.description:
Keyboard type to use on mobile devices. Defaults to the basic text keyboard.

To input number values, you should use the **Number input** component instead.

args.name: disabled
args.title: Disabled
args.tooltip: True/false value to disable the input field. When an input is disabled, it cannot be focused by user interaction, and text can't be inputted into it.
args.description: True/false value to disable the input field. When an input is disabled, it cannot be focused by user interaction, and text can't be inputted into it.

args.name: multiline
args.title: Multiline input
args.tooltip: Allow the input to go on multiple lines.
args.description: Allow the input to go on multiple lines.

args.name: autoCapitalize
args.title: Auto-capitalize
args.tooltip:
Make the input field automatically capitalize certain characters:

- `none`: no forced capitalization
- `sentences`: sentences are forced to start with a capital letter
- `words`: words are forced to start with a capital letter
- `characters`: every character is forced into a capital letter
args.description:
Make the input field automatically capitalize certain characters:

- `none`: no forced capitalization
- `sentences`: sentences are forced to start with a capital letter
- `words`: words are forced to start with a capital letter
- `characters`: every character is forced into a capital letter

args.name: secureTextEntry
args.title: Password input
args.tooltip: True/false value to mask the inputted text by replacing each character with a dot (•), commonly used for password input fields.
args.description: True/false value to mask the inputted text by replacing each character with a dot (•), commonly used for password input fields.

components.name: custom-b304608e-6fe0-463b-b879-e58a1ac2d086
components.lodash_html_template:
<input style="width:100%;border:0;padding:0;margin:0;background:transparent;" type="text" id="<%= getInstanceID('input') %>"
    disabled="<%= events.disabled %>"
    placeholder="<%= component.placeholder %>" 
    ag-bind="<%= component.value %>">

args.name: optionList
args.title: Option list
args.tooltip: The list of options available to the dropdown component, given as an array of objects with `label` and `value`.
args.description: The list of options available to the dropdown component, given as an array of objects with `label` and `value`.

args.name: value
args.title: Selected value
args.tooltip:
Value of the currently selected option.

This is an **Input property**, meaning that any variable bindings are two-way. Changing the bound variable elsewhere affects the selected value, and selecting another value via the dropdown propagates the change to the bound variable.
args.description:
Value of the currently selected option.

This is an **Input property**, meaning that any variable bindings are two-way. Changing the bound variable elsewhere affects the selected value, and selecting another value via the dropdown propagates the change to the bound variable.

args.name: label
args.title: Selected label
args.tooltip:
Label of the currently selected option.

This value is determined by the **Selected value** property. Changing this property will not affect the **Selected value** property, and any changes will get overridden when a new **Selected value** is selected. In essence, this property should be treated as a read-only.
args.description:
Label of the currently selected option.

This value is determined by the **Selected value** property. Changing this property will not affect the **Selected value** property, and any changes will get overridden when a new **Selected value** is selected. In essence, this property should be treated as a read-only.

args.name: placeholder
args.title: Placeholder text
args.tooltip: Placeholder text to show when there's no value selected, i.e. **Selected value** is `null` or `undefined` or does not match any of the values in the **Option list** array.
args.description: Placeholder text to show when there's no value selected, i.e. **Selected value** is `null` or `undefined` or does not match any of the values in the **Option list** array.

args.name: visible
args.title: Visible
args.tooltip: True/false value to set component visibility. If `false`, the component is not rendered at all and will not take up any space.
args.description: True/false value to set component visibility. If `false`, the component is not rendered at all and will not take up any space.

args.name: showSelectedValueAsLabel
args.title: Show value as label
args.tooltip:
If `true`, show selected value as the label in the dropdown. The dropdown options themselves will still be labels.

Useful if you e.g. want to show a dropdown of phone country codes with country name in the dropdown, but just show the selected country code when the dropdown is closed.
args.description:
If `true`, show selected value as the label in the dropdown. The dropdown options themselves will still be labels.

Useful if you e.g. want to show a dropdown of phone country codes with country name in the dropdown, but just show the selected country code when the dropdown is closed.
